title: Series 7 Chair Carver  Charcoal Grey
body: The Seven Series chair were first introduced in 1955 in Sweden at the Helsingborg exhibition. It has become Fritz Hansen & Son's best-selling design of all time. With its ideal shape, it offers the right amount of comfort and support to human body. They were first made with hand to ensure that the perfect shape will be achieved and then later on crafted using automation methods borrowed from the German car industry. The waterfall seat design supports the legs and the back keeps the upper body comfortable, this feature makes this chair one of the most iconic chairs in the history of Fritz Hansen and possibly in furniture history.
